alert.note: Alert for Boone; Northwest Raleigh; Wyoming (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 4:59PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Raleigh, north central Wyoming and southeastern Boone Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 458 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southeast of Bald Knob, or 13 miles north of Pineville, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Sophia, Lester, Kopperston, Glen Daniel, Naoma, Bolt and Arnett. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to travel across flooded roads. Find alternate routes. It takes only a few inches of swiftly flowing water to carry vehicles away.
